intro: Waltheria corchorifolia, commonly known as the silkyleaf mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. It typically grows in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and in wetlands. Waltheria corchorifolia is often used in wetland restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and provide habitat for wildlife.
